newsitem.title: USA: Thieves in U.S. use tow truck in bank withdrawal.
newsitem.headline: Thieves in U.S. use tow truck in bank withdrawal.

text.p: Thieves used a stolen tow truck to winch an automatic teller machine from its foundation, haul it to a cornfield and steal the money inside, police said on Wednesday.
Richard Smith, assistant police chief in this town northeast of Nashville, said the FBI had been called in to investigate but no arrests had been made.
The teller machine was found in a field on Tuesday. It was a stand-alone device, anchored in concrete, owned by the Farmers Bank of Portland.
Smith said the amount of money stolen had not been disclosed.
